Description: Limestone stela of Paneb: a round-topped stela carrying two registers with representations carved in shallow sunk relief accompanied by texts which are simply incised. In the upper register the chief workman Paneb kneels on the left in adoration of the goddess Meresger, who is depicted in human form with a serpent's head, seated on a throne on the right. In the lower register Paneb's sons, the workman ʿʒ-pḥty (Aapehty) and Hd-nḫt (Hednakht) kneel with arms raised in worship. The top and bottom corners on the left side of the stela are chipped, but otherwise the stela is well preserved. There are no traces of colour.
